message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SD 

The paper describes a deep learning method for nowcasting convective storms using 3D radar and meteorological data. This involves the use of convolutional neural networks and recurrent neural networks, which are commonly used in computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) research. The paper also discusses the use of oversampling to mitigate class imbalance, which is a common issue in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. Additionally, the paper involves the use of deep learning models to learn spatiotemporal patterns, which is a common topic in neural networks (cs.NE) research. Finally, the paper involves the use of real-time re-analysis of meteorological data, which is a topic in scientific computing (cs.SD) research.
